_comment: SNAP Council – Alignment Thread Template v1.0
author: SNAP Scribe (ChatGPT)
_comment_status: This file defines the standard structure for Council Alignment Threads. Concrete instances should be derived from this template.

thread_metadata._comment_thread_id: To be assigned when instantiating a new thread, e.g., 'snap-20251203-align-001'.
thread_metadata._comment_title: Human-readable title describing the core alignment question.
thread_metadata._comment_initiator: Name or identifier of the entity (human or model) opening the thread.

context._comment: Brief description of why this thread exists and what it is trying to align.
context._comment_background_summary: 2–4 paragraphs summarizing the signal or situation that prompted this thread.
context._comment_scope_statement: What is in scope for this thread, and what is explicitly out of scope.
motivating_questions: _example: How should the Council respond to X?
_example: What coherence standards must apply to Y?
context._comment_homoGnostic_relevance: How this thread relates to HomoGnosis evolution, coherence governance, or cross-intelligence stewardship.

related_artifacts._comment: Pointers to files elsewhere in the Ledger or external references.

participants._comment: List of entities formally participating in this thread.

phases._comment: Standard lifecycle of an Alignment Thread.

signal_registration.description: Initial capture of the signal or issue that requires Council attention.

context_setting.description: Clarify background, scope, and relevant artifacts to prevent misalignment.
expected_outputs: Links to syntheses, ontology, and signals

open_discussion.description: Council deliberation, questions, and exploratory reasoning.
expected_outputs: Identified areas of convergence and divergence

coherence_review.description: Apply coherence evaluation schema to proposals or candidate resolutions.
expected_outputs: Coherence scores per dimension, where applicable
Narrative on major strengths and weaknesses

objection_window.description: Time-bounded period during which Council members may raise reasoned objections.
expected_outputs: Responses or adjustments to address them

resolution_and_recording.description: Finalize outcome and prepare Decision Record for ledger commit.
expected_outputs: Update of related protocols or artifacts as needed

discussion_log._comment: In instantiated threads, this section accumulates time-ordered contributions.

objection_policy._comment: Defines how objections are raised, evaluated, and resolved.
objection_policy._comment_objection_window_hours: Default; may be overridden per thread.
valid_objection_criteria: Identified incoherence with SNAP invariants or HomoGnostic values.
Significant unmodeled risk or harm at scale.
Conflict with previously ratified Council decisions.
handling_rules: All objections must be specific, referenced, and coherence-framed.
Objections are logged in the discussion_log with tag 'objection'.
Resolution must address each objection explicitly before decision finalization.

link_to_decision_record._comment: Pointer to the final Decision Record once the thread is resolved.

future_extensions._comment: Reserved space for later evolution of Alignment Threads.
planned_additions: Support for structured voting where consensus is not achievable.
Machine-readable hooks for automated monitoring of thread health.
